snippet: The state’s longest-serving corrections commissioner, Christopher B. Epps, faces charges that he pocketed more than $1 million while clearing the way for the private-sector prisons.
abstract: Investigation into Christopher B Epps, Mississippi's longest serving corrections commissioner, paves way for greater discussion and investigation into private-sector prisons in the state, long viewed as troubled; Epps faces charges of receiving more than $1 million in bribes from former state lawmaker Cecil McCrory, beginning in 2007.
lead_paragraph: The state’s longest-serving corrections commissioner, Christopher B. Epps, faces charges that he pocketed more than $1 million while clearing the way for the private-sector prisons.

headline.main: Indictment of Ex-Official Raises Questions on Mississippi’s Private Prisons
headline.print_headline: Indictment of Ex-Official Raises Questions on Mississippi’s Private Prisons
